author: Sefy Levy
description: Detect anthropogenic heavy-metal enrichment using Upper Continental Crust baseline

classifications.name: BACKGROUND (EF < 2)
classifications.notes: Natural geochemical background - no pollution concern

classifications.name: MINOR ENRICHMENT (EF 2-5)
classifications.description: Slight enrichment - may be natural or minor anthropogenic
classifications.notes: Could be natural variation or minor human impact

classifications.name: EXTREME ENRICHMENT (EF > 10)
classifications.notes: Strong pollution signal - likely industrial or mining contamination

classifications.name: NO DATA
classifications.notes: Requires element measurement for EF calculation

notes: Simple EF = X_sample / X_UCC. UCC baselines: Pb=20, As=1.5, Cu=25, Zn=71 ppm (Taylor & McLennan 1995). For full EF, normalize to reference element (Al or Fe). This is screening-level assessment - not legal diagnosis. Can be applied to Pb, As, Cu, Zn, and other trace metals.
